result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison L. Wellmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • UnemployComp-Fraud to Obtain Benefits, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 108.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--$0 restitution
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $100 fine + costs = $379

--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To attempt maintain employment and/or education, per Agent

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allison L. Wellmann

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:01 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Allison L. Wellmann in court with Attorney Peter D. Bear. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To attempt maintain employment and/or education, per Agent
--$0 restitution
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $100 fine + costs = $379

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Court presents basis and denies expungement
Recess: 2:09 pm
Sentencing hearing on August 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 2:39 pm [Case was scheduled for STC]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Allison L. Wellmann in court with Attorney Peter D Bear. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court amends charge to False Statement to Obtain Unemployment Benefits, contrary to 108.24(1), a Misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Atty Bear requests matter be set-over for sentencing, presents basis
ADA Teuber: No objection
Court reminds Ms. Wellmann that her bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending

NEXT: (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 8/1/14 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
Status conference on May 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 10:29 am 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Allison L. Wellmann in court with Attorney Peter D Bear. DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Bear indicates that he has not received a copy of the complaint - DA Happ provides. Ms. Wellmann indicates that she has received a copy of the complaint
Recess: 10:31 am for Atty Bear to review complaint Reconvene: 10:47 am 

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Patti Bickel 
Recess: 10:49 am
